block.description:
Interface with [Unleash server API](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api/unleash). This provider implements a subset of the operations that can be done with Unleash. The focus is mostly in setting up the instance with projects, roles, permissions, groups, and other typical configuration usually performed by admins.

You can check a complete example [here](https://github.com/Unleash/terraform-provider-unleash/tree/main/examples/staged) under stage_4 folder.

environment.description: An environment the token has access to.

project.description: A project the token belongs to.

projects.description: The list of projects this token has access to. If the token has access to specific projects they will be listed here. If the token has access to all projects it will be represented as `[*]`.

auto_create.description: Whether to auto create users when they login to Unleash for the first time.

default_root_role.description: The default root role give to a user when that user is created. Only used if auto_create is set to true.

discover_url.description: A URL pointing to the .well-known configuration of the OIDC provider.

enabled.description: Whether or not OIDC is enabled.

description.description: A description of the project's purpose.

groups.description: List of projects with this role assigned.

users.description: List of users with this role assigned.

roles.description: Roles available in this project with their members.

description.description: A more detailed description of the role and what use it's intended for.

environment.description: For which environment this permission applies (note that only environment-type permissions can have an environment).

permissions.description: A more detailed description of the role and what use it's intended for.

type.description: A role can either be a global root role (applies to all roles) or a role role.

auto_create.description: Whether to auto create users when they login to Unleash for the first time.

certificate.description: The x509 certificate used by the SAML provider.

default_root_role.description: The default root role give to a user when that user is created. Only used if auto_create is set to true.

id.description: The ID of the service account.

name.description: The name of the service account.

root_role.description: The root role ID for the service account.

username.description: The username for the service account.

block.description:
Service accounts do nothing on their own, they need service account tokens to be created to do anything useful.
		All tokens bound to a service account will take on the permissions of the root role assigned to the service account. It's strongly
		recommended to use the unleash_role data source to retrieve one of the built-in roles and use the id from that to set the service account
		role id.

		See the [Unleash documentation](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/service-accounts) for more information.

description.description: The description of the service account token.

expires_at.description: The expiration date of the service account token.

id.description: The ID of the service account.

secret.description: The secret of the service account token.

service_account_id.description: The ID of the service account this token is bound to.

block.description:
Allows for managing the tokens bound to a service account. Note that service account tokens in Unleash
		are both immutable and cannot be recovered once created. This means you must use them immediately when creating them via terraform.
		Typically by piping them to an external secret manager or binding them to some other external terraform resource that requires Unleash tokens.

		Because service account tokens are immutable, any changes to the terraform resource will trigger a deletion and recreation of those tokens,
		meaning that the secrets will be rotated out.

root_role.description: The role id for the user.

send_email.description: Send a welcome email to the customer or not. Defaults to true

display_name.description: The name to display in listings of permissions.

environment.description: Which environment this permission applies to.

type.description: What level this permission applies to. Either root, project or the name of the environment it applies to.

description.description: A description of the project's purpose.
A more detailed description of the role and what use it's intended for.

type.description: A role can either be a global root role (applies to all roles) or a role role.

root_role.description: The role id for the user.
